Articles.Content: I've also noticed a crash bug if station keeping is turned on during circularization. I think it was when the state changed from suborbital to orbital, but it's been a while so I'm not entirely sure any more.

Does this work for version 1.2.2?

**Edited <time datetime="2017-08-18T14:07:09Z" title="08/18/2017 02:07  PM" data-short="6 yr">August 18, 2017</time> by Seanksp**
  
Added Question mark(?)
Yes, if you go to my github you'll find version for 1.2.2. Link few posts back.

I found the link in this forum: for anyone else, Here it is: [https://www.dropbox.com/sh/0rbkv7zl5wnzbio/AADFbXy-H-H1KKM1P5XH76GZa?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/0rbkv7zl5wnzbio/AADFbXy-H-H1KKM1P5XH76GZa?dl=0)

> 
> 
> 54 minutes ago, ZAJC3W said:
> 
> 
> Yes, if you go to my github you'll find version for 1.2.2. Link few posts back.
> 

Hi [<u><font color="#0066cc">ZAJC3W</font></u>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/38402-zajc3w/ "Go to ZAJC3W's profile") , I have tested many differents settings and (in a non modded ksp too) to find a solution of the issues in my precedent post, but it doesn't work. Am I alone to have that problem ? I have also noticed that the mods say me the good decay rate and time when I put a vessel from a <300km to a >300km (just during the burn). But It say me >1000 years and no decay rate when the mod is refreshed after the end of the burn.

Only one of the interface icon is showing content for me, the other shows the Orbital Decay Manager window but nothing inside of it. Does this mean the mod is working but there are interface bugs, or it isn't working at all? The icons aren't showing up at all either.

Update:

So I just found out you have to put the whitecatindustries inside of the Gamedata without pulling the contents out. That is working with 1.2!

I'd like to thank [@ZAJC3W](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/38402-zajc3w/) and [@Whitecat106](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/140086-whitecat106/) for their work on this, thank you!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-08-22T18:23:29Z" title="08/22/2017 06:23  PM" data-short="6 yr">August 22, 2017</time> by Sxldierman**
i hope this goes on to work on 1.3.1

[@ZAJC3W](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/38402-zajc3w/)

I may have a bug report here.

I am playing on KSP 1.3 with Orbital Decay 1.5.4 (the 1.3 version from your GitHub, dd. 8 Aug 17).

The issue I'm *constantly* having is that on all my vessels' (only 5 thus far) orbits the LAN parameter gets set to zero (or some value very close to it) after some time.  

Immediately after launch everything seems fine (LAN retains its value as it should). It usually when I leave the vessel to go to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> and check on all my vessels in the Tracking Station when LAN jumps to zero.

I have temporarily removed Orbital Decay from my GameData and the issue stopped appearing entirely. So I figure it has something to do with it.

In Whitecat106's GitHub I have noticed that there was an **[issue #42 "LAN updating to zero!"](https://github.com/Whitecat106/OrbitalDecay/issues/42)** which was closed on 30 Jul 2016. What I can't see, however, is whether the issue was actually resolved at the time.  

I will happily provide more information concerning my KSP installation/mods if required. Perhaps I'm not the only one fighting with this problem. Thanks in advance to anyone finding the time to consider this issue.

delete

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-27T21:24:39Z" title="10/27/2017 09:24  PM" data-short="6 yr">October 27, 2017</time> by SpacedInvader**

Hey guys, so does this work on 1.3.1? It's a lovely mod which really adds interest in renewing of orbital constellations when they're depleting their fuel. I played with it all the time.

[@ZAJC3W](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/38402-zajc3w/) downloaded your version on Github, will see how it works.. Thanks for trying to keep it up ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

Nope, game crashes on loading if I put GameData contents from your Github to it. What a pity.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-11-25T09:50:37Z" title="11/25/2017 09:50  AM" data-short="6 yr">November 25, 2017</time> by 1valdis**

Largely unadvertised and almost unnoticed, another mod has added basic orbital decay functionality: [Kessler Syndrome](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/154601-131-kessler-syndrome-13-11102017/)

That mod doesn't have the predicted de-orbit time or automatic station keeping, but I always found I didn't use those features anyway. It works perfectly well in 1.3.1.

Its up, [https://github.com/zajc3w/OrbitalDecay/releases/tag/1.54_1.3.1](https://github.com/zajc3w/OrbitalDecay/releases/tag/1.54_1.3.1)

Orbit LAN updating to zero is still happening, very rarely but sucks when your RT network gets disabled. Did some tweaks to hopefully eliminate this.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-11-25T17:50:59Z" title="11/25/2017 05:50  PM" data-short="6 yr">November 25, 2017</time> by ZAJC3W**
as i understand, this awesome mod not working with <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>? crap..

Didn't test it with <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>, decay rates will need adjusting in in-game menu but it should work. 

There's version for ksp1.2.2 in my github
Awesome! I'll have to put this back on my KSP install.

I noticed that the total decay rate shown in the Manager window is inconsistent with the rates shown in the Breakdown Display. The screenshot below is of a probe orbiting the Moon in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>. As you can see in the screenshot, the Manager shows the value for Radiation Pressure Decay only and ignores the Gravitational Effect decay rate.

I use v1.5.4 from ZAJC3W (Thanks!) on KSP 1.2.2 with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>.

Spoiler

![bqyiloycurwwwjc6g.jpg](https://www.mediafire.com/convkey/4f34/bqyiloycurwwwjc6g.jpg)

I played with this mod back in like KSP 1.1.3 with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> and I had thought that this mod had died because on Spacedock the last update was for 1.1.3. Now knowing that this mod is still alive I can't wait to play with it on 1.3.1 with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> because I love having some station keeping without all the complexity of Principia. Although I do have one worry, how well with the automatic station keeping work with RealFuels? If it doesn't work with RealFuels that's fine I can do it myself it's just nice to have that extra feature ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")
For anyone wondering, the mod seems to work just fine in 1.4.1

For the most part yes. I would need to launch something further out than just above the atmosphere to know for sure. Can do that while I wait for korpernicus to update.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-03-25T01:45:53Z" title="03/25/2018 01:45  AM" data-short="6 yr">March 25, 2018</time> by demibear**

Thanks for making this mod playable again all versions.  

But I have a question, when does this mod gets available on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>?  

I can only download the 1.5.2 version and I need the 1.5.4 versionright?

> 
>

> 
> Thanks for making this mod playable again all versions.

That's because there is no officially Update of this mod, only a community update by [@ZAJC3W](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/38402-zajc3w/)

You need to download and install it manually. Link is a few posts above.

Aww, too bad.  Its annoying to remember my mod list. For other mods I use the export/import feature when I do a new playthrough.

I did a small test with this mod in the 1.3.1, using the download link [@ZAJC3W](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/38402-zajc3w/) provided. seems to be working. But I have some questions.

How's the bug of the LANs updating to zero? This tends to decrease performance significantly, especially with a huge amount of vessels?

[@MaximumThrust](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/185090-maximumthrust/)Lan updating to zero seems to be game not returning correct values, same error happens with mass,area and fuel left. it's beyond my capability to eliminate those. Might be game issue or mod requesting data at the wrong moment, no idea.

I did run 50 debris and 20-ish satelites before it bogged down fx8350
